derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'be equivalent to in value, compensate for'): from Anglo-Norman French contrevaloir, from Latin contra valere 'be of worth against'

means.word_mean: 2. oppose and mitigate the effects of by contrary actions;

sentences.sentence: "This will counteract the foolish actions of my colleagues"

auth_sentence.content: These melodious feelings may countervail even the supreme strength of our gonads.
auth_sentence.res_content: These melodious feelings may countervail even the supreme strength of our gonads.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These melodious feelings may countervail even the supreme strength of our gonads.

stems_affixes.word_buile: counter反对,相反+productive有成效的→adj.反效果的
counter反对,相反+balance平衡→两边一样→达到平衡
counter反对,相反+draw画→对着原画做画
counter反对,相反+part部分→反面一样的部分→对应人物
counter反对,相反+work起作用, 造成, 产生→v.与……对抗;阻碍 n. 对抗; [军]对垒
